metadata.Title: CVE-2022-45061 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Python before 3.11.1. An unnecessary quadraticalgorithm exists in one path when processing some inputs to the IDNA (RFC3490) decoder, such that a crafted, unreasonably long name being presentedto the decoder could lead to a CPU denial of service. Hostnames are oftensupplied by remote servers that could be controlled by a malicious actor;in such a scenario, they could trigger excessive CPU consumption on theclient attempting to make use of an attacker-supplied supposed hostname.For example, the attack payload could be placed in the Location header ofan HTTP response with status code 302. A fix is planned in 3.11.1, 3.10.9,3.9.16, 3.8.16, and 3.7.16.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-45061` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1.10
libpython2.7 - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1.10
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1.10
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1.10
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1.10
python2.7 - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1.10
python2.7-examples - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1.10
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

idle-python3.6 - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.9
libpython3.6 - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.9
libpython3.6-minimal - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.9
libpython3.6-stdlib - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.9
libpython3.6-testsuite - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.9
python3.6 - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.9
python3.6-examples - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.9
python3.6-minimal - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.9
python3.6-venv - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1.10').
python3.6 package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.9').
python3.7: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
python3.8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
